title: Luka on Harrison firing: Just focused on Lakers
content: Luka Doncic, asked for his reaction to the dismissal of the man who traded him from Dallas to L.A., said he's "just trying to move on and focus on what I'm doing here."

title: Jokic puts up 55 to match SGA for season high
content: Nikola Jokic had 55 points, tying the highest-scoring performance in the NBA this season, as the Nuggets beat the Clippers on Wednesday night.

title: Skubal gets repeat Cy Young; Skenes unanimous
content: Tigers ace Tarik Skubal became the first back-to-back Cy Young Award winner since Jacob deGrom (2018-19), while the Pirates' Paul Skenes won his first in the NL.

title: Brunson turns ankle, seen exiting MSG on crutches
content: Knicks star Jalen Brunson turned his right ankle on a drive to the basket with under two minutes remaining Wednesday night and was seen leaving Madison Square Garden in a walking boot and using crutches.

title: WR Brown vents about offense, not sorry for stir
content: Hours after video surfaced of him saying things are "a s---show" outside of his family life, an unapologetic A.J. Brown said his discontent is with Philadelphia's offense as a whole, not his own situation.

title: Kidd urges outraged Mavs fans to 'move forward'
content: Mavericks head coach Jason Kidd urged fans to "move forward" after the firing of GM Nico Harrison and stressed that his players are playing hard and "trying to win."

title: Curry's 46 gets Dubs back in groove after blowout
content: Coming off a "humbling" defeat to the Thunder, the Warriors regrouped and shuffled their starting lineup against the Spurs on Wednesday

title: Irish star Hidalgo posts record 16 steals, 44 points
content: Notre Dame star Hannah Hidalgo set a school record with 44 points and broke the NCAA mark with 16 steals to lead the Fighting Irish in a rout of Akron.

title: MLB Awards Week predictions, results: Skenes, Skubal earn Cy Young Awards
content: Baseball's best are collecting their hardware this week. On Wednesday, it was a pair of aces from Pittsburgh and Detroit.

title: What we’re hearing entering Week 11: Kyler Murray’s future, Giants’ next steps, flawed playoff contenders

title: The top 25 NFL free agents for 2026: Ranking players in line to get PAID this offseason
content: We listed the league's top 25 pending free agents -- including Daniel Jones and George Pickens -- and gave intel on who might return to their current team.

content: The Cougars top the first in-season edition of our projections. See the 67 other teams that made the cut.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Giannis dominates for Bucks, Pistons take the East
content: NBA insiders break down this week's power rankings and where all 30 teams stack up after an exciting stretch of games.

title: NWSL awards: Temwa Chawinga is MVP, but silly season is upon us
content: Temwa Chawinga is the league's dominant player and will rightly be named MVP. As for the rest of the NWSL awards? That's all up for debate.

title: UFC 322 preview: Where have all the champ-champs gone?
content: Nine years ago this weekend, Conor McGregor became the first fighter to hold two UFC belts simultaneously.

title: 'Signing bonus?' Gronkowski jokes about contract at Patriots retirement ceremony
content: Pats owner Robert Kraft asked Rob Gronkowski about a two-day contract  at the ceremony, prompting a joke.

title: Facts to guide your Week 11 feelings about C.J. Stroud, Derrick Henry and more

content: The most and least favorable matchups for this week's NFL games at four key positions: QB, RB, WR and TE.

content: Ahead of the early signing window, which 10 programs are already ahead with the class of 2026? Let's start with USC.

title: Luka Doncic trolled by teammates after dunk against Hornets
content: According to Basketball Reference, the dunk marked Luka Doncic's third slam in the past two seasons -- two with Los Angeles this season.

title: USC claps back after B1G said fake punt should've been penalized
content: The Big Ten said on Sunday that USC should've been penalized for the fake punt pass they executed last Friday.

title: How Premier League teams are borrowing NFL plays for set piece success
content: Set piece mania has taken over the Premier League but it seems that teams are taking plays from the NFL. Here's what they have learned.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool, Spurs tracking West Ham's Bowen
content: Liverpool and Tottenham Hotspur are looking at West Ham forward Jarrod Bowen. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: T.N. increases dearness allowance for government employees, teachers to 58%
content: According to an official release, Chief Minister M.K. Stalin has ordered an increase in the DA from the existing 55% to 58%, with effect from July 1, 2025

title: Not every Kashmiri is a terrorist: Omar Abdullah
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister sought punishment for those responsible for the Delhi blast but warned against harming any innocents in the process

title: Quality concerns raised over IV cannulas in Tamil Nadu government hospitals
content: There have been numerous incidents of cannulas breaking, leaving the plastic fragments inside patients’ veins

title: Small trainer aircraft makes emergency landing on Tamil Nadu’s highway
content: Airport sources said the Cessna 172 type single engine aircraft was on a training mission when it made an emergency landing due to technical reasons.

title: Air India flight 171 crash: Supreme Court says probe aims to find cause, ensure future safety, not to assign blame
content: “The object of the probe is to clarify the cause and then give recommendations so that such a situation does not arise again,” Justice Bagchi observed

title: U.P. committed to empowerment, inclusion of tribal communities: Adityanath
content: The Uttar Pradesh CM was speaking at an event organised in Lucknow as part of the ongoing Janajatiya Gaurav Pakhwada

title: Four major infrastructure firms bid for tunnel road project in Bengaluru
content: Rail Vikas Nigam Limited (RVNL), Adani Group, Vishwa Samudra Engineering, and Dilip Buildcon Limited have submitted bids

title: SC adjourns hearing on Dubai firm's plea against award of Dharavi redevelopment project to Adani
content: A Bench comprising Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai and Justices K. Vinod Chandran and Vipul Pancholi noted the CJI will not be able to complete hearing in the matter as he is due to retire on November 23

title: Bihar Assembly Election 2025: where and how to watch the results live
content: The results of the Bihar Assembly Election 2025 will be announced on November 14. Voters can track real-time counting updates and official trends on The Hindu’s live blog.

title: Home Minister Amit Shah praises schemes worth ₹45,000 crore for exporters after Cabinet nod
content: Amit Shah said India's export sector is reinforced with a new support system, as the ₹25,060-crore ‘Export Promotion Mission’ has been approved by the Union Cabinet

title: SC bans mining activities within one km radius of national parks, wildlife sanctuaries
content: The top court also directed the Jharkhand government to notify the Saranda region as a wildlife sanctuary

title: Supreme Court finds T.N. challenge to Mekedatu reservoir project ‘premature’
content: The Supreme Court said that in case of approval of DPR, affected parties, including Tamil Nadu, would be free to take measures in accordance with the law

title: Kerala govt medical college teachers association strike hits functioning of colleges
content: Other than emergency, casualty and labour room services, other departments and classes for medical students were disrupted

title: Watch: Anand Teltumbde interview | Can BJP’s Hindutva co-opt caste census?
content: Caste census is not social justice, but data justice, says intellectual and author Anand Teltumbde during a conversation with The Hindu on his latest book ‘Caste con census’

title: Techie arrested for hitting scooter carrying family of three in Bengaluru
content: The impact caused the scooter to fall on the road divider, throwing the family on to the road. The accused allegedly fled from the spot without stopping to help, police said

title: Himachal CM's photo on police patrol vehicle draws ire of BJP
content: BJP chief spokesperson Rajinder Singh Rana said in a statement that the government has failed to control crime and its priority was "self publicity"

title: Mysuru police probe fake Facebook account linked to Kerala woman’s number used in cyberattack on K.C. Venugopal
content: Offensive post appeared from a Facebook profile which reportedly used the same mobile number linked to the complainant. The woman, who has been residing in Mysuru for years, said she has been using a phone number registered under the name of her sister, who works abroad

title: Bharat Forge evinces interest in river cruise project at Andhra’s Gandikota reservoir
content: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu explained to Bharat Forge vice-chairman over the abundant opportunities available in the State for investments

title: Andhra Pradesh inks pact with Tillman
content: The MoU was facilitated by Dr. Mukesh Aghi, president & CEO, USISPF, and Sachit Ahuja, co-president, Tillman Global Holdings

title: Driver killed as girder collapses on pick-up van during elevated highway work in Kerala
content: According to police, accident occurred around 2.30 a.m. when workers lifted the girder and placed it on a hydraulic jack, which then skidded, causing the massive concrete beam to fall onto the pick-up van passing below

title: Cabinet decisions on exports to improve competitiveness: PM Modi
content: Union Cabinet, at a meeting chaired by Mr. Modi on November 12, 2025, approved the export promotion mission and a credit guarantee scheme for exporters

title: Regional PF Commissioner appeals to employers in Karnataka to hire under PM-VBRY and utilise voluntary enrolment scheme
content: The scheme will benefit the employers as well under Part B, which offers incentives of up to ₹3,000 per month for each additional employee retained for at least six months

title: Delhi Red Fort blast: Nine more arrested in Assam for 'offensive' social media posts, tally rises to 15
content: Minors and those who were unaware that their devices were used to make such posts will not be arrested, but those responsible will not be spared, Mr. Sarma said

title: 34 lakh Aadhaar card holders identified as ‘deceased’ in West Bengal, UIDAI informs ECI
content: The UIDAI authorities also communicated to the ECI that about 13 lakh people in the State never possessed Aadhaar cards, but have since died

title: Odisha: 8 people trapped on 30-foot-high mechanical swing at Bali Jatra rescued
content: The incident took place when the swing suddenly stopped as the eight visitors to Bali Jatra were on it

title: Delhi blast LIVE updates: Faridabad Police detain man in connection with second car linked to blast; death toll rises to 13
content: DNA test confirms that Pulwama doctor, identified as Umar Nabi, was driving car that exploded near Red Fort

title: From pier to pixel: Campaigns for Kerala local body elections get a digital makeover
content: Hiring professional photographers and content strategists, candidates are exploring digital tools to drum up their campaign on social media to attract young voters

title: Muslim League to leverage Kerala local body polls as launch pad for 2026 Assembly election
content: Party has already secured seat-sharing agreements with its United Democratic Front allies in most of the 1,999 local bodies. Negotiations are still under way in a few local bodies. According to party State general secretary P.M.A. Salam, a final agreement is expected within a day or two

title: Hyderabad: Traffic diversions in Aramghar due to ongoing road repairs
content: Aramghar is the key junction on the Hyderabad-Bengaluru Highway and connects the east-west corridor in the southern part of Hyderabad

title: Can lawyers break client confidentiality? | Explained
content: Is the counsel between a lawyer and client a privileged communication? Which are the three circumstances in which a lawyer can communicate what his client has said? Why is safeguarding this evidentiary privilege important? Is a lawyer a constitutional actor?

title: Man-eater leopard should be shot at sight, says Maharashtra Forest Minister
content: Ganesh Naik also argued that if the leopards are not sterilised, then these animals will roam like dogs in the residential area.

title: Severe respiratory and cardiac cases push treatment costs up 11%: Report
content: The other key findings showed that children are the hardest hit, making up nearly half of all pollution-linked insurance claims with the claims escalating 14 % post-Deepavali

title: How Albert Theatre became Madras’ cultural landmark
content: Consisting of big-screen Albert and the smaller Baby Albert, the venue became a matter of pride for those living in Egmore, and they referred it to as namma (our) theatre

title: Professors deliberate on formative exams as a form of assessment
content: The academia seems to be inclined towards adopting formative methods of assessment, involving continuous, low-stakes techniques, to ensure better learning outcomes.

title: Congress, seven parties decide to form anti-BJP front in Assam
content: The objective is to defeat the Bharatiya Janata Party in the 2026 Assembly elections, Congress leaders said

title: Chromium above permissible limit in 95% people in Kanpur Nagar; NGT directs U.P. government to map affected people
content: The NGT said that Amicus Curiae in the case, advocate Katyayni, has informed the court that initially the issue was confined to the Kanpur Nagar, Kanpur Dehat and Fatehpur, but the affected area is increasing

title: Petition at Madras High Court seeks ban on Muthuramalinga Thevar biopic for ‘incorrect portrayal’ of Kamaraj
content: Hari Nadar of Shathriya Sandror Padai has filed the PIL plea claiming that the movie may lead to caste clashes between Nadars and Thevars

title: Ministry of External Affairs rolls out ‘upgraded version’ of Passport Seva Programme
content: The MEA describes the introduction of e-passports alongside PSP V2.0 a ‘significant milestone for the Ministry’

title: Excess rains in Mumbai linked to 8% deaths in monsoon months
content: The monsoon months of June-September frequently register days of extremely heavy rainfall made worse, as scientists say, by human-caused climate change.

title: Driver, doctor accused in blast case visited Red Fort in January
content: One of them visited Turkiye a few years ago, officials suspect that during the visit, accused doctor met one of his handlers from the Jaish-e-Mohammed; Faridabad police recover a red Ford EcoSport car linked to accused from a village in Haryana

title: Youth skills vital for India’s future, says Lokesh
content: Only 34.7% of the workforce in India has formal skill training; there is an urgent need for skill-oriented education, says the Minister at the CII–VIT Andhra Pradesh Higher Education Conclave 2025

title: Centre to amend and reform Plant Variety Act: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: A group of scientists had recently written to the Union Agriculture Minister, demanding the government’s intervention to protect India’s sovereign rights over its vast genetic wealth

title: Over 40 lakh people screened for cancers under Gruha Arogya scheme
content: Between August to October, 16,277 suspected cases were referred for further investigation. Of these, there were 552 confirmed diagnoses

title: BJP appoints four new general secretaries to Mumbai unit
content: This is seen as the party’s effort to reach out to several communities in Mumbai, essential for civic body elections

title: Over 30 lakh deceased voters likely to be removed from West Bengal electoral rolls based on Aadhaar data
content: As of 4 p.m. on Wednesday, 6.87 crores (89.67%) of enumeration forms had been distributed across West Bengal.

title: Ukraine war a ‘living lab’, India adapting lessons for future conflicts: Army chief
content: The Army is moving towards Industry 5.0, a shift from automation-driven systems to human-centric technology, said General Dwivedi

title: ED seizes ₹21.71-crore assets linked to accused in $20-million crypto fraud case
content: The ED investigation revealed that the trusted websites were spoofed in such a way by search engine optimisation that when the website would be searched, the spoofed one would appear at the top

title: Vigilant civic society partnered with courts to drive progress in gender justice: CJI
content: ‘Collective voice of citizens has ensured that regressive precedents were questioned, debated, and ultimately corrected through reform or legislative intervention’

title: Delhi blast: Al-Falah University distances itself from accused doctors; police raids on campus, nearby villages
content: University Vice-Chancellor expresses concern over allegations made by ‘online platforms’ about laboratories being used for storing explosives materials; the police conduct door-to-door searches in Fatehpur Taga for explosives and suspects

title: NIA conducts searches across five States in Al-Qaeda Gujarat terror conspiracy case
content: The searches were carried out on premises linked to various suspects and their associates in West Bengal, Tripura, Meghalaya, Haryana, and Gujarat. Several digital devices and  documents were seized

title: Supreme Court to examine if farmers are evading satellite surveillance
content: Amicus curiae claims that agriculturists burn crop residue after surveillance satellite passes; court seeks latest report on stubble burning from Punjab and  Haryana

title: India, Botswana announce cheetah translocation pact; President Murmu says ‘will take good care of them’
content: The two heads of State will preside over an event where five of the eight captured cheetahs will be released into a quarantine facility at Mokolodi nature reserve, marking the symbolic handing over of the hunting cats to India by Botswana as part of ‘Project Cheetah’ and under a mutual initiative for wildlife conservation

title: Child safety: Seven departments in Karnataka issue joint circular
content: With an aim to curb teen pregnancies, child abuse, and child marriages, seven departments have issued a joint circular asking authorities concerned to initiate a slew of measures

title: Trinamool accuses EC of issuing orders favouring BJP during SIR in Bengal
content: Party claims BJP benefits from ECI notice allowing appointment of BLAs from different polling booths within same Assembly constituency; BJP raises concerns about political affiliations of BLOs

title: Enumeration forms distributed to 73% voters in Phase 2 of SIR, says Election Commission
content: Lakshadweep has topped the list covering all but one voter — 57,812 of 57,813 voters or nearly 100%; Goa is a close second having covered 99.99%; Kerala is lagging behind other States with only 49.55% coverage; West Bengal and Tamil Nadu, which witnessed protests against the SIR, have covered 88.8% and 78.09% voters respectively

title: Over 600 detained across Kashmir; Jamaat-e-Islami premises searched
content: The crackdown on suspects in Kashmir was stepped up after the Red Fort blast, which left 13 civilians dead.

title: Death toll in Bilaspur train tragedy hits 12
content: An initial probe conducted by the Railways reportedly found that the crew of the MEMU passenger train failed to control it at the red signal

title: IISc study finds that anthropogenic changes threaten survival of Eastern Himalayan birds
content: The team tagged birds with lightweight aluminium rings and revisited the same sites annually to track their survival and changes in body mass

title: Five years on, Hosakerehalli flyover to open by weekend, trials begin
content: The 400-metre project, which began in August 2020 at a cost of ₹30 crore, and is often dubbed the ‘brother’ of the Ejipura Flyover, was originally scheduled for completion in 2022

title: Keep tabs on guests, install CCTV cameras, Hyderabad police tell owners of hotels and lodges
content: Verification of guest identities, maintenance of visitor records and installation of CCTV cameras were among the key points discussed

title: Codename 'Ukasa': Turkiye handler directed Delhi terror module; how bomber's 2022 trip became key
content: A Turkiye-based handler, codenamed Ukasa, allegedly directed a terror module led by Al-Falah University professor Umar Un Nabi in a plot hatched in 2022. The group, linked to JeM and AGuH, planned spectacular attacks in India, including at Red Fort and Ayodhya, using vehicle-borne IEDs and explosives.

title: '32 vehicles with explosives': Agencies uncover new details in Delhi blast probe
content: Intelligence agencies have uncovered a wider terror plot linked to the Delhi Red Fort car explosion, revealing plans to rig 32 vehicles for coordinated attacks across multiple cities. Investigations revealed suspects were modifying vehicles and preparing to execute serial blasts with multiple IEDs, with eight suspects working in pairs assigned to specific cities.

title: ISI-Pak terror module busted in Punjab: Grenade attack foiled; 10 held
content: Ludhiana Police have apprehended ten individuals linked to an ISI-backed grenade attack plot targeting a crowded Punjab locale. Investigations reveal foreign handlers in Pakistan, with coordination routed through three operatives in Malaysia for grenade delivery. This operation aims to disrupt cross-border terror networks and maintain state peace, thwarting a significant threat.

title: Delhi blast: AAP alleges 'costume change' on a blast victim; BJP claps back
content: BJP Delhi refuted AAP's claims of fabricating Prime Minister Modi and Chief Minister Gupta meeting the same patient in different conditions. BJP clarified that the CM met the patient immediately after the incident, while the PM visited after the patient had received treatment, calling AAP's allegations 'dirty politics'.

title: MS Dhoni's IPL 2026 plans: Gym, swimming, 2 hrs of power-hitting - 'Just Mahi things'
content: MS Dhoni is training rigorously in Ranchi to stay match-ready for IPL 2026. The 44-year-old spends nearly five hours daily at the JSCA Stadium — gym, nets, and swimming. Despite CSK’s poor IPL 2025 campaign, CEO Kasi Viswanathan has all but confirmed that Dhoni isn’t retiring, even as Sanju Samson is set to join the squad

title: AI careers: IBM chief scientist to engineering grads; stop chasing tech giants everyone runs after
content: IBM Chief Scientist Ruchir Puri advises young engineering graduates to broaden their job search beyond tech giants, highlighting AI's impact across all industries. He suggests considering companies like John Deere, emphasizing that software engineers are crucial in sectors undergoing digital transformation.

title: No major impact of Trump tariffs? Moody’s says India to be fastest growing major economy
content: India will be the fastest growing major global economy, with Moody's forecasting a strong 6.5% expansion through 2027. This resilience comes despite US tariffs, as Indian exporters successfully diversify markets.

title: 'No job is safe anymore,' shares laid-off Amazon employee: 6 ways to future-proof your career in an age of AI layoffs
content: Amazon's job cuts highlight a new reality for professionals.  Artificial intelligence is reshaping industries, making even skilled roles vulnerable.  To thrive, workers must embrace change, develop uniquely human skills like empathy and creativity, and build strong professional networks.  Continuous learning and staying informed about technological shifts are crucial for career survival and growth in this evolving landscape.

title: IND vs SA: 'Not many bowlers ...' - Captain Gill breaks silence on Shami's omission
content: Captain Shubman Gill admitted leaving out Mohammad Shami for the South Africa Test series was a tough call, praising the veteran's class despite selecting a younger pace attack. Gill also discussed managing his captaincy workload across formats, acknowledging the mental challenge. He stressed India must be at their best against the strong South African side in the crucial WTC race.

title: Red Fort blast: Phone apps terrorists used to plot attack, talk; Session app explained
content: Terrorists linked to the Delhi Red Fort blast reportedly used the encrypted messaging app Session, alongside Signal and Telegram, for coordination.  The app, which requires no personal information and operates on a decentralized network, allows for untraceable communication.  This feature, along with local data storage and complete encryption, makes it a tool of concern for security agencies.

title: Olympic legend Surya Bonaly loses all her medals to Las Vegas thieves while caring for her cancer-stricken mother
content: Olympic figure skater Surya Bonaly is devastated after thieves stole all her career medals while she was in Minnesota caring for her mother, who is also battling cancer. The burglary at her Las Vegas home revealed broken windows and destroyed security cameras, with surveillance footage indicating multiple individuals were involved over several days.

title: Bloodshed at Maharashtra wedding: Groom stabbed on stage; drone captures assault
content: A wedding in Amravati turned violent when a man, identified as Raghav alias Ragho Jitendra Bakshi, stabbed groom Sujal Samudre (22) on stage. The shocking incident, captured by a drone, left guests in panic. While the groom is stable, the motive is suspected to be a dispute over DJ payment, leading to retaliatory vandalism at the accused's home.

title: Vibe coding: Meta’s AI chief has advice for teens: Says they should spend time on..
content: Meta's Chief AI Officer Alexandr Wang urges teenagers to master AI tools, comparing the current era to the dawn of personal computing. He advises dedicating thousands of hours to 'vibe-coding' – hands-on experimentation with AI – to gain a significant advantage in the future economy, much like early programmers did.

title: Trump tariffs: Will Export Promotion Mission be able to counter impact? Top challenges
content: India's new Export Promotion Mission, approved with ₹25,060 crore over six years, aims to boost exports by supporting MSMEs and offering non-financial aid. However, experts warn of implementation delays due to its conceptual stage, pending digital platforms, and insufficient annual funding. Effective execution hinges on interdepartmental coordination and more resources.

title: Islamabad blast aftermath: PCB moves entire tri-series to Rawalpindi amid tight security
content: Pakistan's T20 tri-series against Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe will now be entirely held in Rawalpindi due to security concerns following a recent bombing. The tournament kicks off November 18th, with all matches starting at 6 pm. Sri Lanka's team will remain in Pakistan, with assurances of high-level security provided by the PCB chairman.

title: Why is NEET PG counselling 2025 delayed? A familiar cycle of disruption returns
content: Thousands of doctors face unemployment as NEET PG 2025 counselling is indefinitely postponed. This delay, attributed to seat matrix revisions and withdrawn seats, creates a critical workforce vacuum in hospitals, straining services. The situation highlights a recurring pattern of administrative and legal disruptions impacting postgraduate medical admissions since 2019, leaving students and institutions in prolonged uncertainty.

title: Stephen Curry’s sweet reply to wife Ayesha after divorce rumours
content: Divorce rumors surrounding Stephen and Ayesha Curry have been fueled by viral podcast clips. However, the couple has publicly dismissed these speculations with heartfelt Instagram posts. Ayesha's candid remarks about her evolving views on marriage and motherhood sparked online debate, with fans divided over her statements and their potential impact on the family's image.

title: Bihar election result 2025: Date, time and where to watch live counting
content: Bihar braces for a pivotal political outcome on Friday as vote counting for the 2025 Assembly Elections commences at 8 am. Exit polls suggest a strong performance for Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's NDA, potentially securing another term. The RJD-led Mahagathbandhan faces an uphill battle as the state awaits its next leadership.

title: 'Captaincy isn't about English' - Axar Patel hits out at stereotypes
content: India all-rounder Axar Patel has challenged the notion that English fluency defines a captain's leadership, emphasising that understanding players and extracting their best is paramount.  He believes public perception, influenced by media and social media, often overshadows a cricketer's true capabilities and on-field value.

title: 'Sharam nai aati': Sunny Deol loses his cool at the paps
content: Veteran actor Dharmendra has returned home after a hospital stay, but his son Sunny Deol was seen expressing frustration towards paparazzi gathered outside their residence. The Deol family has requested privacy during Dharmendra's recovery, appreciating the public's well wishes while urging them to respect their personal space.

title: Antonio Brown placed under house arrest on attempted murder charge with GPS monitor
content: Former NFL star Antonio Brown faces an attempted murder charge in Florida, now under house arrest after extradition from Dubai. He was granted $25,000 bail with strict conditions, including a GPS monitor and no contact with the alleged victim. The charge stems from a May incident at a celebrity boxing event where witnesses claim Brown fired gunshots.

title: 'Would've quit chess, if not for Goa': Story of legend putting Anand's record in danger
content: Levon Aronian is making a strong bid for his third Chess World Cup title in Goa, a location holding significant personal history for the Grandmaster. Winning the FIDE World Junior Championships there 23 years ago was a pivotal moment that revived his career.

title: Groww shares surge! Billionbrains Garage Ventures m-cap inches closer to Rs 1 lakh cr
content: Groww's parent company, Billionbrains Garage Venture, is nearing a Rs 1 lakh crore market cap after a strong stock market debut. Shares surged post-listing, rewarding IPO investors with significant returns. Experts see Groww as a proxy for India's expanding capital market.

title: Gujarat shocker: Wife’s 5 brothers hack off 60-yr-old’s legs in Amreli
content: A 60-year-old man, Dinesh Solanki, was brutally attacked and killed by his wife's five brothers in Amreli district while attempting to reconcile a marital dispute. Solanki's legs were severed with an axe during the violent assault at his niece's home. Police are actively searching for the accused, with the incident believed to be linked to the ongoing family conflict.

title: Ladakh airbase close to China border activated; Nyoma underwent Rs 230cr upgrade - Why it matters
content: India has boosted its military strength in eastern Ladakh with the operationalization of the new Nyoma airbase. This strategic move enhances troop and supply movement capabilities. Simultaneously, a large Army exercise, 'Poorvi Prachand Prahar', is underway in Arunachal Pradesh. These developments underscore India's high military readiness along the China frontier.

title: Russell Wilson’s sweet moment with young patients melts hearts online
content: Denver quarterback Russell Wilson's weekly visits to Mount Sinai Pediatrics have become a cherished ritual, offering comfort and joy to children and staff. His consistent presence, filled with genuine interaction and support, demonstrates a deep commitment to lifting spirits beyond his public platform. These Tuesdays provide emotional respite and motivation for families navigating difficult medical journeys.

title: 'I’ll do my homework': AB de Villiers responds to Surya’s 'please help me' request
content: India's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav sought advice from AB de Villiers on balancing performances across formats. The Proteas legend, renowned for his mastery of all three disciplines, expressed enthusiasm for the conversation and invited Suryakumar for a deeper discussion on his YouTube channel.

title: Delhi blast: New image shows bomber Umar near mosque before explosion — what seized diaries reveal
content: Fresh images emerge of Dr. Umar Un Nabi, a key suspect in the Red Fort blast, near a mosque. Investigators are probing his movements and a terror plot spanning over two years, revealed by diaries found in doctors' lodgings. The recovered notebooks detail planned strikes and a network of 25-30 individuals, primarily from Jammu & Kashmir and Faridabad.

title: Hailee Steinfeld cheers Miles Caton as ‘Sinners’ bags Grammy nominations
content: Hailee Steinfeld is celebrating a significant week. Her film Sinners received multiple Grammy nominations. This marks a new career achievement for the actress and singer. Steinfeld also discussed her growing enjoyment of golf. She shared her thoughts on the sport in her newsletter. Steinfeld finds the game fun and relaxing. She encourages others to embrace golf's enjoyable aspects.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: What strategy should investors follow?
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Gold and silver prices are poised for further gains, with both MCX Gold and MCX Silver exhibiting bullish breakouts from inverse head and shoulders patterns. Analysts anticipate continued upward momentum.

title: Aurora australis puts on dazzling show across New Zealand & Australia — photos
content: Australia and New Zealand witnessed a spectacular aurora australis, a 'cannibal' solar storm causing vibrant pink, violet, and green lights. This G4 geomagnetic storm, one of the strongest, was caused by colliding solar energy bursts.  Another viewing opportunity is expected tonight, though geomagnetic activity is declining.

title: 'Forever grateful': Rishabh Pant’s emotional message after comeback from injury
content: Rishabh Pant shared his mindset and lessons learned during recovery in a BCCI video, emphasizing gratitude and focusing on controllable aspects. He highlighted the importance of discipline and enjoying the process for growth, reflecting on his return to cricket after a foot fracture during the Manchester Test against England.

title: NEET PG Counselling 2025: NBEMS issues key guidelines; reporting and joining steps explained
content: NEET PG 2025 counselling sees NBEMS issuing crucial advisories for candidates. Ensure all original documents are presented for verification and medical fitness is confirmed by hospital boards. Mandatory first-year course fee payment to NBEMS via their portal is required before joining. Reporting and joining status must be updated promptly on the Intra-MCC portal to avoid seat forfeiture.

title: Red Fort blast: Victim’s wife stops funeral in Meerut, takes body back to Delhi
content: A family dispute over burial location delayed Mohsin's funeral in Meerut by five hours after his death in the Red Fort blast. His wife insisted on a Delhi burial, citing his aspirations for his children. Ultimately, his parents relented, allowing his body to be taken to Delhi for final rites, honoring his dreams.

title: NASA 2025 warning Earths oceans nearing collapse and facing 2050 climate disaster
content: Decades after his initial climate warning, NASA scientist James Hansen now highlights an alarming acceleration in climate shifts. His team's research points to a potential collapse of the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (AMOC) within 20-30 years, a critical system regulating global temperatures. This could trigger catastrophic weather changes, but solutions like carbon fees and public awareness offer hope.

title: Islamabad blast: Sri Lanka Cricket orders team to stay in Pakistan; PCB reschedules ODIs
content: Sri Lanka Cricket has directed its national team to continue their Pakistan tour despite security concerns following a suicide bombing, threatening players with a formal review if they leave early. Replacements will be sent if players depart against directives. The PCB has rescheduled ODI matches and enhanced security measures.

title: 'Money dispute between docs': Delhi blast suspects planned serial strikes in 4 cities — new details emerge
content: Investigative agencies revealed that eight terrorists planned serial blasts across four Indian cities, intending to move in groups of two with multiple IEDs.  The plot involved raising funds and procuring over 20 quintals of NPK fertilizer for explosives.  The investigation is also examining the preparation of additional vehicles for the attacks.

title: ‘Led to erectile dysfunction’: Man tells HC his wife’s love for stray dogs caused stress
content: A man has approached the Gujarat high court seeking a divorce, citing cruelty by his wife who allegedly brought stray dogs into their home, causing public humiliation and distress. The court is reviewing his appeal after a family court dismissed his divorce petition, deeming the wife's actions, including a prank call about an affair, insufficient grounds for divorce.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex near 84,400
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Thursday. While Nifty50 was near 25,850, BSE Sensex was above 84,400.

title: ‘Clearly a terror attack’: Marco Rubio praises India’s handling of Delhi blast
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio condemned the Delhi bomb blast as a "clearly a terrorist attack" and expressed solidarity with India. Following a meeting with External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar, Rubio commended India's investigation, stating authorities were "doing a great job" and reaffirmed US support for counterterrorism efforts.

title: Rohit Sharma yet to confirm Vijay Hazare Trophy participation: Mumbai chief selector
content: Mumbai chief selector Sanjay Patil has not yet received confirmation from former India captain Rohit Sharma regarding his availability for the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Sharma's training at the MCA-BKC ground suggests a potential return to competitive cricket. Meanwhile, Tanush Kotian and Mohit Awasthi are set to rejoin Mumbai's Ranji Trophy squad.

title: When Hema Malini spoke about Dharmendra's 1st wife Prakash
content: Veteran actor Dharmendra, recently discharged from hospital, lives with his first wife Prakash Kaur and their four children, including Sunny and Bobby Deol. Hema Malini, Dharmendra's second wife, expressed respect for Prakash Kaur and stated she is satisfied with Dharmendra's role as a father to their daughters, Esha and Ahana.

title: LeBron James’ injury comeback draws ex-teammate’s reaction amid Lakers roster shake-up
content: Despite LeBron James' absence due to injury, the Lakers are thriving with Luka Doncic and Austin Reaves. Former teammate Richard Jefferson believes James will reintegrate seamlessly, asserting that Reaves will need to adjust to LeBron, not the other way around. Jefferson highlighted James' proven adaptability with various elite teammates, suggesting he can easily fit with the current Lakers roster.

title: Logo threes to golf tees: Caitlin Clark's Annika Pro-Am highlights
content: the 2024 WNBA Rookie of the Year competed last year alongside Nelly Korda and played the back nine holes . this wasn't Clark's first experience at the Annika pro-am . here were the best moments from Clark at the event .

title: After Acquittal Of Nithari Murders Accused, Victims' Families In Despair
content: The serial murders in Uttar Pradesh's Noida in 2006 shocked the entire country. Following acquittal of both the accused men- Moninder Singh Pandher and his servant Surinder Koli- the silence at the Nithari village is deafening.

title: Tri-Services Chiefs Board INS Vikrant, Review Op Under 'Exercise Trishul'
content: The three commanders-in-chief of the armed forces boarded aircraft carrier INS Vikrant and reviewed a joined multi-domain operation conducted as part of the mega Exercise Trishul, officials said on Thursday.

title: Tamil Nadu Hikes Dearness Allowance By 3% For Government Staff, Teachers
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin declared a three per cent hike in Dearness Allowance for state government employees, teachers and pensioners.

title: Camel Breaks Through Car's Roof, Gets Stuck After Head-On Crash In Rajasthan
content: A car collided head-on with a camel in Rajasthan's Jodhpur, trapping the animal within it for several hours. The accident occurred near Kolu Pabuji on the Phalodi-Dechu road early Wednesday morning.

title: Centre Orders Probe Into Al Falah University's Funding After Delhi Blast
content: The government has ordered an Enforcement Directorate (ED) probe into the funding of the Al Falah University in Faridabad where the Delhi blast was allegedly planned, said sources.

title: Al-Falah University Gets Notice After Its Doctors Caught In Terror Web
content: Two wings of the Faridabad-based Al-Falah University, which has come into focus after doctors working there were found to be allegedly involved in terrorist activities, have received a show-cause notice from a key body under the Education Ministry

title: 18-Year-Old Bengaluru College Student Alleges Sexual Harassment On Way Home
content: An 18-year-old college student was allegedly sexually harassed by an unidentified man in Bengaluru on November 10. A First Information Report (FIR) has been registered against an unknown person.

title: Retired Mumbai Lawyer Loses Nearly Rs 10 Crore In Fake Trading Racket
content: A former Larsen & Toubro (L&T) officer and retired lawyer from Mumbai has been defrauded of Rs 9.94 crore in a cyber scam run under the guise of a reputed financial firm.

title: Fake Cops Use Bomb Scare For Cyber Fraud, Rajasthan Police Issues Alert
content: The Rajasthan Police has issued an urgent warning about a new cyber fraud tactic where criminals impersonate police officers and threaten citizens using the pretext of a serious criminal incident.

title: Hyundai i20 Used In Delhi Blast Was Bought For Rs 1.70 Lakh Through OLX
content: The Hyundai i20 that exploded near Red Fort was purchased from a Haryana-based car dealer for Rs 1.70 lakh, for Dr Umar Mohammad to carry out the terror attack earlier this week.

title: New Video Shows Delhi Bomber In Mask At Toll Booth, Big Bag Inside i20 Car
content: A fresh CCTV footage has emerged of Dr Umar Mohammad, who drove the Hyundai i20 that exploded near Red Fort, from a toll plaza at Delhi-Haryana border.

title: Aadhaar Body Says 34 Lakh Card Holders Identified As "Deceased" In Bengal
content: About 34 lakh Aadhaar card holders in West Bengal have been found to be 'deceased' since the identity card was introduced in January 2009, UIDAI authorities informed the Election Commission.

title: 1.94 Crores Meant For Bengaluru College Students Siphoned Off By 2 Staffers
content: Two women, working as assistant clerks at Indian Institute of Science (IISc) in Bengaluru and one of their boyfriens have been arrested for allegedly misappropriating Rs 1.94 crore that was allocated for student foreign travel grants.

title: The 1979 Rape Case Verdict That Chief Justice Said "Embarrassed" Judiciary
content: Chief Justice of India (CJI) BR Gavai has said that the Supreme Court has failed its citizens at times, but the vigilance of civil society and courage of ordinary people have kept the judiciary accountable over the years.

title: Unrest In Bangladesh As Dhaka Court Sets Hasina's Trial Verdict For November 17
content: The Muhammad Yunus regime in Bangladesh is not happy with New Delhi permitting the former Prime Minister, Sheikh Hasina, to freely interact with the media.

title: Why Are People Still Looking For Amelia Earhart, Who Disappeared 90 Years Ago
content: It has been more than 88 years since the world's most famous female aviator, Amelia Earhart, and her navigator Fred Noonan, disappeared on the second-last leg of their around-the-world flight odyssey.

title: Trump's "Favourite Field Marshal" Asim Munir Gains More Powers
content: The lower house of parliament approved a constitutional amendment bill expanding Munir's control over the military branches. PM Shehbaz Sharif said the move would strengthen national unity, the state-owned Associated Press of Pakistan reported.

title: Opinion: Opinion | What Happens Once Trump Presses The Nuclear 'Test' Button?
content: With China and Russia already rushing to modernise their nuclear arsenals, the US move to resume nuclear testing pushes the concepts of deterrence and stability to its limits.

title: This New UIDAI App Makes It Safer And Easier To Carry Your Aadhaar Identity
content: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has launched a new Aadhaar mobile app to make carrying and sharing your Aadhaar identity easier and safer. It acts like a digital Aadhaar wallet.
